threat: A remote attacker might be able to exploit this to execute arbitrary code; however, the default compiler options for affected releases should reduce the vulnerability to a denial of service.
This may allow remote attackers to conduct absolute path traversal attacks and possibly create or overwrite arbitrary files.
This could make it easier for an attacker to discover a cleartext password containing an 8-bit character that has a matching blowfish crypt value.
This could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service via a NULL pointer dereference or possibly execute arbitrary code.
This could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service via an application crash.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
In general, a standard system update will make all the necessary changes.
